channel.title: Comments on: Link Library
channel.description: WordPress Plugins, Plugin Development Cookbook and random thoughts

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/link-library/comment-page-17/#comment-23570">Kristin</a>.
Hi Kristin, I just wanted to mention that the Colorbox pop-up dialog, which I added to Modal Dialog earlier this year, does trap keyboard events correctly. Go to the General Settings for Modal Dialog and select Colorbox and you will see the behaviour you were seeking.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Kristin.

Hi Kristin, I just wanted to mention that the Colorbox pop-up dialog, which I added to Modal Dialog earlier this year, does trap keyboard events correctly. Go to the General Settings for Modal Dialog and select Colorbox and you will see the behaviour you were seeking.

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/link-library/comment-page-17/#comment-30007">ylefebvre</a>.
thanks Yannick. I guess it was the parameters that were confusing me.
I knew most of the layout was set up through the library settings but it wasn't clear that the info in the FAQ like - "[link-library rssoverride=0] Set to 0 or 1 to display or not display rss information" was a full list of options.
Thanks for the assist. DAvid
item.content:encoded:
In reply to ylefebvre.

thanks Yannick. I guess it was the parameters that were confusing me.

I knew most of the layout was set up through the library settings but it wasn’t clear that the info in the FAQ like – “[link-library rssoverride=0]
Set to 0 or 1 to display or not display rss information” was a full list of options.

Thanks for the assist.
DAvid

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/link-library/comment-page-17/#comment-29967">David</a>.
All shortcodes for Link Library are displayed at the top of the Library Settings page. There are a few optional parameters for these shortcodes, and these are shown on the FAQ (<a href="http://wordpress.org/plugins/link-library/faq/" title="Link Library FAQ" rel="nofollow">FAQ</a>)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to David.

All shortcodes for Link Library are displayed at the top of the Library Settings page. There are a few optional parameters for these shortcodes, and these are shown on the FAQ (FAQ)

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.description:
Okay, I'm sure I'm asking the most obvious question, but ... where do I find a list of all shortcodes for Link Library?
Thanks in advance DAvid
item.content:encoded:
Okay, I’m sure I’m asking the most obvious question, but … where do I find a list of all shortcodes for Link Library?

Thanks in advance
DAvid

item.title: By: pressingon
item.dc:creator: pressingon
item.description: Thank you so much for creating this awesome plugin. It's doing exactly what I need it to except for one thing; the pagination is not working. When i click on second page the url changes, but the links stay the same. Can you tell me what I'm doing wrong please, or how to fix it?
item.content:encoded: Thank you so much for creating this awesome plugin. It’s doing exactly what I need it to except for one thing; the pagination is not working. When i click on second page the url changes, but the links stay the same. Can you tell me what I’m doing wrong please, or how to fix it?

item.title: By: Jim
item.dc:creator: Jim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/link-library/comment-page-17/#comment-26311">ylefebvre</a>.
Sorry I'll try to be clearer. Say I have ten links with id#40 of which five are id#40 and also id#5 and five id#40 and also id#32. I then set up a page that shows all the links with id#40. It lists all ten links in one list. I'd like to show the ten links grouped by the secondary id. So the 40&5 links and then the 40&32 links. Hopefully with headers identifying the grouping.
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
In reply to ylefebvre.

Sorry I’ll try to be clearer. Say I have ten links with id#40 of which five are id#40 and also id#5 and five id#40 and also id#32. I then set up a page that shows all the links with id#40. It lists all ten links in one list. I’d like to show the ten links grouped by the secondary id. So the 40&5 links and then the 40&32 links. Hopefully with headers identifying the grouping.

Thanks

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/link-library/comment-page-17/#comment-26297">Jim McCarthy</a>.
I am not quite sure I understand your question. Links are sorted within each category. Link Library does not consider tags.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jim McCarthy.

I am not quite sure I understand your question. Links are sorted within each category. Link Library does not consider tags.

item.title: By: Jim McCarthy
item.dc:creator: Jim McCarthy
item.description:
Is it possible to sort Links by Category or Tag?
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Is it possible to sort Links by Category or Tag?

Thanks

item.title: By: Kristin
item.dc:creator: Kristin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/link-library/comment-page-17/#comment-23164">ylefebvre</a>.
No - I'm not displaying a form. Just text and a link to the website, as in your default options.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to ylefebvre.

No – I’m not displaying a form. Just text and a link to the website, as in your default options.

item.title: By: ylefebvre
item.dc:creator: ylefebvre
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/wordpress-plugins/link-library/comment-page-17/#comment-23240">Kristin</a>.
Thanks for the link. I will see about using the basic jQuery dialog as an option in Link Library in the coming week and see if that properly captures keyboard inputs. To make an example that reflects what you are doing, can you tell me a bit about what you are displaying in your Link Library popup? Are you displaying a form related to the link that was clicked?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Kristin.

Thanks for the link. I will see about using the basic jQuery dialog as an option in Link Library in the coming week and see if that properly captures keyboard inputs. To make an example that reflects what you are doing, can you tell me a bit about what you are displaying in your Link Library popup? Are you displaying a form related to the link that was clicked?
